cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 50 mi W of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking north-northwest across the central Gulf, then turning northwest toward the northern Gulf Coast (Louisiana) and eventually drifting into east-central Texas.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Louisiana coast near Intracoastal City–Grand Isle area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch from Sabine Pass TX eastward to the AL/FL border; Hurricane Watch from Intracoastal City LA to the MS/AL border
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Texas through Louisiana, Mississippi, and Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (sustained 25–40 mph, gusts 40–50 mph) are possible Tuesday night into Wednesday with a peak 34-kt probability of 22% and only 6% for 50-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge (1–2 ft) possible along upper Texas coast; significant >3 ft surge not expected in Galveston Bay.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches with isolated pockets near 5 inches Tuesday–Wednesday could cause localized street flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents beginning late Monday; periodic squalls may temporarily reduce visibility for vessel movements.
